past.meaning: I decided after thinking

present.meaning: I decide after thinking

future.meaning: I will decide after thinking

past.meaning: I slept as soon as I got home

present.meaning: I sleep as soon as I get home

future.meaning: I will sleep as soon as I get home

past.meaning: I smiled as soon as I saw

present.meaning: I smile as soon as I see

future.meaning: I will smile as soon as I see

past.meaning: I went as soon as I heard

present.meaning: I go as soon as I hear

future.meaning: I will go as soon as I hear

past.meaning: I left as soon as I ate

present.meaning: I leave as soon as I eat

future.meaning: I will leave as soon as I eat

past.meaning: I spoke as soon as I knew

present.meaning: I speak as soon as I know

future.meaning: I will speak as soon as I know

past.meaning: Class started as soon as I arrived at school

present.meaning: I shower as soon as I wake up

future.meaning: I will shower as soon as I wake up

past.meaning: The cat went out as soon as I opened the door

present.meaning: The cat goes out as soon as I open the door

future.meaning: The cat will go out as soon as I open the door

past.meaning: I showered as soon as I woke up

present.meaning: I shower as soon as I wake up

future.meaning: I will shower as soon as I wake up

past.meaning: I went home as soon as it ended

present.meaning: I go home as soon as it ends

future.meaning: I will go home as soon as it ends

past.meaning: I called as soon as I arrived

present.meaning: I call as soon as I arrive

future.meaning: I will call as soon as I arrive

past.meaning: I called right away as soon as I heard the news

present.meaning: The cat goes out as soon as I open the door

future.meaning: I will get a job as soon as I graduate

past.meaning: I got a job as soon as I graduated

present.meaning: The cat goes out as soon as I open the door

future.meaning: I will get a job as soon as I graduate

past.meaning: I congratulated as soon as I heard the news

present.meaning: I contact as soon as I know

future.meaning: I will tell as soon as I find out

past.meaning: I started the next task as soon as I finished

present.meaning: I start another as soon as one ends

future.meaning: I will go on vacation as soon as work ends

past.meaning: I read it as soon as I received it

present.meaning: I read as soon as I receive

future.meaning: I will read as soon as I receive

beginner.meaning: You may enter
You may eat
You may go
You may rest
You may watch

intermediate.meaning: You may sit here
You may take pictures
You may ask questions
You may go first

advanced.meaning: It is okay to come late tomorrow
It is okay to speak in Korean
It is okay to borrow this book
It is okay to open the window

beginner.meaning: You know, I am busy
You know, I am tired
You know, I am hungry
You know, it is cold
You know, it is hot

intermediate.meaning: You know, I have an exam tomorrow
You know, I have a lot of work these days
You know, I am meeting a friend today
You know, I am going on a trip this weekend
You know, I am looking for a new job

advanced.meaning: You know I was very tired yesterday
You know, that project is complicated
You know, learning Korean is difficult
You know, the economy is not good these days
You know, that person is really kind

beginner.meaning: I told you yesterday, you know
It is here, you know
I already did it, you know
I am busy tomorrow, you know
I said it like that, you know

intermediate.meaning: We have an exam today, you know
I already have an appointment, you know
That person is a friend, you know
Tomorrow is a holiday, you know
Wait here, you know

advanced.meaning: I cannot speak Korean well, you know
That work is already finished, you know
We met yesterday, you know
That restaurant is delicious, you know
We have to leave tomorrow, you know

beginner.meaning: It is delicious (I realize)
It is pretty (I realize)
It is fun (I realize)
It is big (I realize)
It is small (I realize)

intermediate.meaning: The weather is nice (I realize)
There are many friends (I realize)
Time passes quickly (I realize)
This place is quiet (I realize)
That person is kind (I realize)

advanced.meaning: It is harder than I thought (I realize)
It is really amazing (I realize)
It is faster than expected (I realize)
I did not know it would be this easy (I realize)
The view from here is beautiful (I realize)

present.meaning: I make them laugh

present.meaning: I make the team cooperate

past.meaning: I made her cry

present.meaning: I make him worry

future.meaning: I will make everyone satisfied

past.meaning: I made the market active

present.meaning: I make culture develop

future.meaning: I will make society better

beginner.meaning: I was cute when I was young
I was busy when I was a student
I played when I was young
I was happy when I met you yesterday
I met a friend when I went to school

intermediate.meaning: It was fun when I went to Korea
I learned a lot when I attended university
I was nervous when I entered my first job
I was happy when I got married
I was happy when I had a child

advanced.meaning: When I was a university student was good
I felt great achievement when I completed that project
I was relieved when I passed the difficult exam
I was excited when I had my first romance
All the effort was worthwhile when I succeeded

beginner.meaning: It seems it was delicious
It seems it was fun
It seems it was difficult
It seems it was easy
It seems it was pretty

intermediate.meaning: It seems it rained
It seems that person was busy
It seems my friend was happy
It seems the exam was easy
It seems the weather was nice

advanced.meaning: It seems they watched that movie
It seems the project was successful
It seems they worked at that company
It seems they were good at Korean
It seems they knew that fact

advanced.name: -았/었으면 좋겠어요
advanced.explanation: Express wishes about past or future

beginner.meaning: I wish the weather were nice
I wish I had a lot of money
I wish I had time
I wish I had a friend
I wish my house were big

intermediate.meaning: I wish I could speak Korean well
I wish I woke up early
I wish I exercised
I wish I read more books
I wish I traveled

advanced.meaning: I wish there were no exam tomorrow
I wish I had studied harder
I wish I had not missed that opportunity
I wish I had played more when I was young
I wish I had known that person better

beginner.meaning: My friend said they would go
Mom said to eat
Dad said to study
The teacher said to be quiet
My friend said to wait

intermediate.meaning: The teacher said the exam is difficult
My friend said let's meet tomorrow
My parents said to be careful
My younger sibling said they want to play
Grandma said to be healthy

advanced.meaning: That person said they would go to Korea
The company president said the project was successful
The professor said the students studied hard
The doctor said the patient would recover quickly
The reporter said the incident was under investigation

combo.name: Past + Causative
combo.description: Combine past tense with causative (-게 하다)
combo.explanation: Express past actions that caused something to happen

beginner.meaning: Yesterday, I laughed with my friend
Last week, I put the child to sleep
Yesterday, I read a book with the student
Last month, I went to meet my friend
Yesterday, I had a meal with the child

intermediate.meaning: Last year, I cooperated with the team
Last week, I came to work early with the employees
Yesterday, I helped the students become quiet
Last month, I danced with the children
Last year, I sang with my friend

advanced.meaning: I made the team successful in the last project by helping them
I made my friend happy last year by comforting them
Last week, I made my friend feel good by helping them
Yesterday, I made my sibling feel good by giving them a gift
Last month, I made my family feel good by spending time with them

boss.meaning: Yesterday, my friend asked for help so I helped
Last week, my sibling asked for help with homework so I helped
Yesterday, the child wanted to play so I let them play
Last month, my friend was sad so I comforted them
Yesterday, the student wanted to read a book so I let them read

combo.name: Future + Want
combo.description: Combine future tense with want (-고 싶다)

beginner.meaning: I will want to learn Korean next year
I will want to travel next week
I will want to meet my friend tomorrow
I will want to rest on the weekend
I will want to exercise next year

intermediate.meaning: I will want to learn a new hobby next month
I will want to become healthier next year
I will want to get a job at a good company next week
I will want to travel around the world next year
I will want to learn cooking next month

advanced.meaning: I will want to become an expert next year
I will want to become a team leader in the next project
I will want to contribute to society next year
I will want to start a new challenge next week
I will want to become a better person next year

boss.meaning: Next year, I will want to meet with friends
Next week, I will want to travel to Jeju Island
Tomorrow, I will want to watch a new movie
On the weekend, I will want to rest at home
Next year, I will want to exercise at the gym

beginner.meaning: I turned on the radio because I was sleepy while driving
I carried a fan because it was hot while walking
I listened to music because I was tired while studying
I ate snacks because I was hungry while cooking
I opened the window because it was hot while cleaning

intermediate.meaning: I listened to the radio because I was sleepy while driving
I opened the window because it was hot while cleaning
I ate food because I was hungry while shopping
I took medicine because I was sick while studying
I listened to music because I was stressed while working

advanced.meaning: I took notes because I was bored while in the meeting
I asked for help because it was difficult while doing the project
I took deep breaths because I was nervous while presenting
I did part-time work because I had no money while traveling
I asked questions because I didn't understand while learning

boss.meaning: While driving, I drank coffee because I was sleepy
While walking, I rested in the shade because it was hot
While studying, I took a short break because I was tired
While cooking, I ate fruit as a snack because I was hungry
While cleaning, I turned on the air conditioner because it was hot

combo.name: After + Try
combo.description: Combine after (-고 나서) with try (-아/어 보다)
combo.explanation: Express trying something after completing another action

beginner.meaning: After eating dinner, I tried watching Korean dramas
After finishing homework, I tried calling my friend
After exercising, I tried taking a shower
After reading a book, I tried writing in my diary
After eating breakfast, I tried brushing my teeth

intermediate.meaning: After working at the company, I tried drinking coffee at a cafe
After taking the exam, I tried eating chicken with friends
After watching the movie, I tried finding a good restaurant nearby
After shopping, I tried resting at home
After finishing exercise, I tried showering and falling asleep

advanced.meaning: After finishing the presentation, I tried having a company dinner with colleagues
After entering graduate school, I tried starting research experiments
After preparing for job hunting, I tried practicing for interviews
After returning from a business trip abroad, I tried experiencing the local culture
After moving to a new apartment, I tried greeting the neighbors

boss.meaning: After eating dinner, I watched Korean dramas
After finishing homework, I called my friend
After exercising, I took a shower
After reading a book, I wrote in my diary
After eating breakfast, I brushed my teeth

combo.name: If + Seems
combo.description: Combine if (-으면) with seems (-은/는 것 같아요)

beginner.meaning: If the weather is nice tomorrow, it seems like I will take a walk
If my friend has time, it seems like I will meet them
If the exam is easy, it seems like it will end early
If this food is delicious, it seems like I will come again
If this movie is interesting, it seems like I will tell my friend

intermediate.meaning: If I have a lot of money, it seems like I will travel
If I have time, it seems like I will study more
If the weather is bad, it seems like I will stay home
If my friend is busy, it seems like I will go alone
If the food is expensive, it seems like I will find another place

advanced.meaning: If the project succeeds, it seems like I will be promoted
If the exam is difficult, it seems like I will study harder
If the company is good, it seems like I will work there for a long time
If my friend helps, it seems like I will be grateful
If the weather continues to be good, it seems like I will plan a trip

boss.meaning: If the weather is nice tomorrow, it seems like I will go to the park for a walk
If my friend has time, it seems like we will meet at a cafe
If the exam is easy, it seems like I will go home early
If this food is delicious, it seems like I will eat it again next time
If this movie is interesting, it seems like I will recommend it to my friends
